title: Application Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Not too difficult. expected more technical concepts and questions did not receive such. Management seemed nice. When meeting it will be a Zoom meeting and the follow up is with the CIO.
Interview Questions: What was a difficult task or project that you personally resolved and/or contributed to?

title: Clerk Typist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Friendly and fast, interview done as a walk in and immediately met supervisor . Well organized and immediate response and offer to me. Typing a must for this position and good people skills
Interview Questions: Prior experience related to this job

title: Pre Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center (Paramus, NJ) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was easily set up in one phone call and they were very timely manner. Two interviewers took turn asking questions and explaining what job description will be. Really friendly since I was really nervous
Interview Questions: What I would do with fast pace changes ?

title: Physician Extender Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and easy. The Chief Operating Officer was easy to talk to and made me feel comfortable and welcomed. The interview felt simple and more like a conversation rather than a series of interrogative questions.
Interview Questions: What are some of your weaknesses

title: Student Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center (Paramus, NJ) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: I really enjoyed the interview process. The interviewer was really nice and I had a really positive interview experience. The questions that were asked were behavioral based and I was confident throughout the interview.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and Friendly they are all kind individuals ... they did not make me feel nervous one bit ... they are definitely open to hire new graduates however one with a prior Medical experience working

title: Par Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Easy, spoke with hiring HR manager roughly 30 mins, same day after interview met supervisor and director.  Easy apply online but must follow up with HR. Process took less than one month to hire and start

title: PCP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview with human resources.  If they like you then you get introduced to meet manager of the department you applied for.  Then there is a 2 week-minimum training. They prepare you to handle crisis situations with behavioral health patients.  Theres compliance training, and net-learning training that needs to be completed.   There was a walkthrough around the grounds.

title: Medicare Sales Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed oriented. Friendly and very professional. The process was more than 30 minutes but to the point. The manager was very polite and direct with her questions. She expected detailed responses from me as well as my capabilities in computer technology.

title: Patient Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center (Paramus, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Before offering an interview, they respond pretty quickly to applications. I got my response the next day. The interviewers are friendly. They ask you emergency scenario based question. They also give you an opportunity to ask your own questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center (Paramus, NJ) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Nasty HR department got the job, management is even worse. They lie, backstab, manipulate, play favorites, hide things under the carpet, a lot of write-ups, be prepared! No vacations but lots of excuses as to why you can't have off. Usually, because the favorites in the group got it!
Interview Questions: Basically, who do you know to get a job?

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center (Paramus, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly longer than usual. The hardest part is sitting and watching videos for hours about safety, culture of hospital...etc. but at least you get paid for your time. Took about 2-weeks to finally get hired.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center (Paramus, NJ) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initially I was phone interviewed by the labor relations manager and she asked general questions, nothing too deep or specific. Then, about a week later I got called back and they requested an in-person interview at the facility in Paramus. When I went there were 4 women interviewing me, the labor relations manager, the recruiting manager, the worker's compensation manager and the benefits manager. They were all extremely nice and asked me a series of behavioral and situational questions.
Interview Questions: If you had to choose between getting your work done, or a team project done, which would you prioritize?

title: Alcohol and Drug Counselorol and Drug Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center (Paramus, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: I began as a Volunteer, always available and offered an opportunity to impress the Supervisor with work ethic which turned into a part time job with almost full time hours.
Interview Questions: There were none. I was hired on the basis of what they saw.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center (Paramus, NJ) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: hiring process was good, i applied online and then they called me for interview. had to take an lpn exam. which wasnt so bad. they give you a list to follow. HR was kind. interview was a breeze. however i do well interviews. communication is usually through email. and once hired its a week FT orientation during the day

title: Helpdesk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center (Paramus, NJ) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, one with Human Resources the other with the management. Did a drug test, TB Test. Questions were pretty generic, they ask you how you perform under pressure, things about your personality. This will vary department to department, there is no baseline interview that the whole facility uses, it is at the managers discretion.
Interview Questions: How do you work under stress.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Bergen New Bridge Medical Center (Paramus, NJ) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: Primarily substance abuse and Psych hospital.  Live in area so well aware of institution, worked as agency nurse there prior to interview   Because I was known to administrator of Dept was hired immediately.  Human Resources not very aggressive about getting back to candidate, must do follow up persistently.
Interview Questions: Can you deal with chronic drug addicts who abuse the system without appearing judgemental or condescending.
